title: Home
text:
Hello, I am Romain Fernex, a first-year student of the Master in Economics at SciencesPo Paris. Before I joined this master, I graduated in management, with a major in finance, from ESCP Europe and Korea University. I am mainly interested in the topic of inequalities, environmental economics and health economics. Countrywise, I have a keen interest for the East Asian area (notably South Korea and Japan).
Feel free to reach out to me using the following address :  “romain.fernex” followed by “@sciencespo.fr”

title: Home

My previous master thesis on Inequalities in Access to Care in the US (written under the supervision of Pr. Jérôme Creel). You can find my presentation support here

title: Home
text:
Code Demo

data(iris) # load the freely accessible dataset named "iris"
summary(iris) # display a simple statistical summary of this dataset

  Sepal.Length    Sepal.Width     Petal.Length    Petal.Width   
 Min.   :4.300   Min.   :2.000   Min.   :1.000   Min.   :0.100  
 1st Qu.:5.100   1st Qu.:2.800   1st Qu.:1.600   1st Qu.:0.300  
 Median :5.800   Median :3.000   Median :4.350   Median :1.300  
 Mean   :5.843   Mean   :3.057   Mean   :3.758   Mean   :1.199  
 3rd Qu.:6.400   3rd Qu.:3.300   3rd Qu.:5.100   3rd Qu.:1.800  
 Max.   :7.900   Max.   :4.400   Max.   :6.900   Max.   :2.500  
       Species  
 setosa    :50  
 versicolor:50  
 virginica :50  
                
                
                

model = lm(iris$Sepal.Length ~ iris$Petal.Length)
# create a linear model trying to explain the sepal length by the petal length
plot(x = iris$Petal.Length,
  y = iris$Sepal.Length, 
  xlab = "Petal Length",
  ylab = "Sepal Length") # plot those two variables
abline(model) # draw the linear regression line on the plot
